page.title: 04Traffic Survey
page.content: The bridge from Banff to Macduff across the River Deveron is a very busy place. Our traffic survey showed that,in an hour,the number of vehicles which crossed the bridge was 631. That can be split up as follows: cars 464 buses 5 minibuses 11 transit vans 54 cycles 4 motor bikes 4 lorries 46 H.G.V.s 6 small vans 37 In a day the total number of vehicles must be about 8000.From these results we found that a lot of trade traffic passes through Banff and Macduff.This is because there is a large farming and fishing industry along the Moray Firth.
